title: University of Cambridge in trademark battle with rowing company
description: The 800-year-old university is in a legal battle with the founder of a rowing company.
content:
When Omar Terywall launched his company, Cambridge Rowing Limited seemed the obvious name for it.
The company runs the Cambridge Rowing Experience, which takes novice rowers on to the River Cam for a taste of the sport.
But the University of Cambridg... [3761 chars]

title: 'The peace is disturbed': Pop star Skye Newman wins the BBC Sound of 2026
description: Coming from a "broken background", Skye Newman's visceral, powerful pop has made her one to watch.
content:
Loud, raw, and strikingly honest: Pop singer Skye Newman has won BBC Radio 1's Sound of 2026.
The award caps a 12-month period in which Ed Sheeran and Lewis Capaldi personally invited the 22-year-old on tour. Sir Elton John is also on board, calling ... [7032 chars]

title: Two people wounded in shooting involving federal agents in Portland
description: The Department of Homeland Security says the incident began with the traffic stop of a Venezuelan gang member.
content:
Two people have been wounded in a shooting involving US federal agents in Portland, Oregon, say officials.
The city's police department said in a statement that a man and woman had been taken to hospital and their conditions were unknown.

title: FA Cup third round: 10 things to look out for this weekend
description: Macclesfield and Weston-super-Mare carry the non-league hopes while fringe players need to seize their chances

title: Two people shot by US federal agents in Portland, police say
description: Mayor urges ICE to pause operations as congresswoman says victims alive but extent of injuries unknown
content:
US federal agents shot two people in Portland, Oregon, on Thursday afternoon, Portland police said.
